result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey Allen Heinl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

fr M. Rizter stating she went to her bank that the payments for this case were being drawn from, and the bank told her they are all older than 30 days, so there is nothing they can do. from M. Ritzer stating the payments made from her checking account to this case were not authorized by her.  I informed M. Ritzer that she needed to contact her bank and dispute these charges through her bank, and her bank will need to investigate further and contact WICourts where the payments originated. cah

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Corey Allen Heinl appeared. Case called at 2:03 pm. Includes 15CM137, 15CM153 and 15CM200. ADA Correll recites agreement. No objection from Atty Caton. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one in 15CM137 without domestic Abuse Enhancer, count one in 15CM153 without domestic abuse enhancer and count 2 in 15CM153, def pleads Guilty to amended count one in 15CM137, amended count one and count two in 15CM153. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of amended count 1 in 15CF137 and amended count one and count two in 15CM153. All other charges are dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. Court questions. Court orders: 
- 45 days Jail total for all charges with 8 days credit. Huber for work. Good time
- Def to report to the jail by October 9th
- DNA Sample and Surcharge on one count
- Court Costs on all counts. Apply Bond. Reminder to be paid on payment plan. km

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $850.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jennifer C. her children and residence or Rebecca L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
